instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sensor Issue
threads.message:
Hello,

Logic board gets to S0 state but has generic SMC error.
HWMonitor shows that heatpipe inlet temp and heatpipe outlet temp are 128C.

Inlet temp is <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR> attached to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, but does anyone know what sensor or bus heatpipe outlet temperature would be? Trying to find if there is a shared data line.

Thanks

Stefan

Edit: Inlet temp is on SMC 1 dataline, and finstack is on SMC 2, so they don't share a data line. And finstack appears to be reporting correctly anyway.
Pull up resistors for SMBUS SMC 1 are OK, and it appears that the lines are varying in voltage like there is data (don't have oscilloscope unfortunately).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sensor Issue
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR> is used for outlet temp report too.
This is the reason you get the same temp value.

Check for corrosion on its area. Be sure to have good continuity to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>.
Maybe need to change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sensor Issue
threads.message:
Okay, Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5830</TRANSISTOR>, no change.
Replaced  <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> as well with no change.
I can see that <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> communicates on SMC S0 "1" SMBus, and the camera and <CHIP>U5620</CHIP> use that as well, and are not reporting errors. Pull up resistors are in good shape as well. 
Sensors <TRANSISTOR>Q5860</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q5810</TRANSISTOR> attatched to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> are reporting normally.
Diode mode measurements at pins 2 and 3 of <CHIP>U5800</CHIP> match my good working board.
Gor frustrated and cut traces at <CAPACITOR>C5801</CAPACITOR> and rebuilt temp sensor dead bug style near <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, and verified it is connected according to the schematic, and still not reporting correctly.
I'm stumped on this one. Could this be a SMC issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Sensor Issue
threads.message:
Okay, trackpad replacement fixed it. No damage or corrosion to trackpad. IPD flex OK. Trackpad uses SMC "3" SMBus but was somehow interfering with the other data lines? Or HWmonitor not naming the sensors correctly?

Anyway, it's fixed, and I feel a bit silly.
